title: Boards and Scorecards: Executive Visibility Without Theater
hook: Most AMS reporting is designed to look busy. Modern AMS boards are designed to force decisions.
idea: A board is not a status wall. It’s a control surface: it shows flow, risk, and cost so leaders can intervene early and correctly — without micromanaging.
board_principles: Few boards, each with a single purpose.
Every column represents a decision or a gate.
If a metric is shown, it must be actionable.

core_boards.name: Operational Control Board
shows: Current P0/P1 incidents with owner and next update time
Blocked items and why they are blocked

core_boards.name: Problem Elimination Board
shows: Problems by load eliminated vs remaining
decisions_enabled: Shift capacity from changes to prevention

review_rhythm.daily: Operational board: remove blockers, assign owners, protect focus.
review_rhythm.weekly: Problem + Change boards: commit, rebalance, kill low-value work.
review_rhythm.monthly: Scorecard: adjust incentives, capacity, and priorities.
review_rhythm.quarterly: Strategy reset: demand drivers, lock-in reduction, tech bets.

anti_theater_rules: No color without explanation and action.
No slide decks replacing live boards.

copilot_moves: Auto-update boards from live signals and work systems.

why_this_works: Leaders intervene earlier and less often.
Teams are protected from random pressure.
design_question: If this board went red, what decision would we make immediately?
